noun.description: An instance of missorting; something, especially a letter, which has been missorted.

verb.description: To allot to a wrong place in sorting; (now) (specifically of mail) to sort incorrectly.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in The Daily News. From missort<br>late 16th century; earliest use found in Richard Mulcaster (?1532–1611), schoolmaster and author. From mis- + sort.
